Class Database

  • java.lang.Object
    • Database

  • public class Database
extends Object
    This is a singleton class that represents the database of the framework. It contains the method to update itself. The constructor is private as you must not use it. Instead use the getInstance method to get the only object of the class (or to create it). It has three private attributes.
    Author:
    Albex
    See Also:
    updates(Stack)

      private static Database instance 
      private HashMap<String,Stack<Terminator>> terminators

    • Constructor Detail

      • Database

        private Database()
        This the constructor of the class. It is private as it must not be called. Use the method getInstance() instead.
        See Also:
        getInstance()

      • Database

        private Database(HashMap<String,ArrayList<Predicate>> initialDB,
        HashMap<String,Stack<Initiator>> initialInitiators,
        HashMap<String,Stack<Terminator>> initialTerminators)
        This is the second constructor of the class that allows to initiate the database. It is private as it must not be called. Use the method getInstance(initialDB, initialInitiators, initialTerminators) instead.
        Parameters:
        initialDB - is the initial database.
        initialInitiators - contains all the initiators of the actions or events.
        initialTerminators - contains all the terminators of the actions or events.
        See Also:
        getInstance(HashMap, HashMap, HashMap)

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static final Database getInstance()
        This is the method to get an instance of the class. Use it as shown: Database.getInstance()
        Returns:
        the only instance of the class Database.

      • getInstance

        public static final Database getInstance(HashMap<String,ArrayList<Predicate>> initialDB,
                   HashMap<String,Stack<Initiator>> initialInitiators,
                   HashMap<String,Stack<Terminator>> initialTerminators)
        This is the second method to get an instance of the class. It allows one to initiate all the attributes of the class.
        Parameters:
        initialDB - is the initial database.
        initialInitiators - contains all the initiators of the actions or events.
        initialTerminators - contains all the terminators of the actions or events.
        Returns:
        the only instance of the class Database.

      • printOut

        public final void printOut()
        This method display the state of the database in the console.

      • updates

        public void updates(Stack<Predicate> events)
        This is the method that updates the database when the step cycle asks so. This should be only used by a CycleState implementation.
        Parameters:
        events - the events that have been triggered during the previous cycle.
        See Also:
        DatabaseUpdateState
